meanings.definition: The amount that a tank can hold.
meanings.sent1: I need a tankful of gas to drive to the next town.
meanings.sent2: The gas station attendant filled my car with a tankful of fuel.
meanings.sent3: My fish tank is so small, it can only hold a single tankful of water.
meanings.sent4: The tankful of knowledge I gained from the seminar was invaluable.
meanings.sent5: The tankful of memories from our road trip will stay with me forever.

meanings.definition: The act of filling a tank to capacity.
meanings.sent1: I always make sure to get a tankful of water for my plants.
meanings.sent2: The truck driver stopped to get a tankful of diesel before hitting the road.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally spilled a tankful of milk while trying to pour it into a glass.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a tankful of joy that filled the room.
meanings.sent5: The chef added a tankful of flavor to the dish with his secret ingredient.
